title: Jeffrey Ullman KAIST 전산학과 초청강연
content:
제목 : Associaltion Rules and Extensions
 
   연사 : Jeffrey Ullman
   시간 : 2006년 12월 13일(수), 16:00-
   장소 : 오상수 강의실(#4443호실)
 
 
abstract :

The famous a-priori algorithm for mining association rules, or
frequent itemsets, can be improved upon by a number of hashing-based
techniques that increase the size of the data sets that can be
processed with a fixed amount of main memory.  There are also
important variants of the problem where the goal is to find highly
correlated pairs of items (possibly of low frequency), rather than the
most frequent itemsets.  This problem requires completely different
techniques for efficient execution on large datasets.  In this talk,
we survey the main ideas behind all these developments.
